acceptContributions.bankAccount.info: Sincroniza manualmente las contribuciones recibidas en tu cuenta bancaria con el presupuesto de tu Colectivo.
acceptContributions.definePaymentInstruc: Incluye cualquier detalle que los contribuidores necesitaran para enviarte dinero, tales como: nombre y numero de la cuenta; IBAN, Swift, or código de ruta, nombre y dirección del banco, etc. El monto y el ID de la orden o pedido se incluirán automáticamente.
acceptContributions.FAQ.howDoesItWorkDet: Las instrucciones para la transferencia bancaria serán enviados a los contribuidores por correo electrónico con un único identificador de transacción. Una vez el dinero haya sido recibido en la cuenta bancaria del Host, el administrador del Host podrá ser marcada la transacción como recibida en el Panel de Control del Host y los fondos serán añadidos al presupuesto del colectivo.
acceptContributions.FAQ.idNotIncluded: ¿Qué sucede si el ID no está incluido en la transacción?
acceptContributions.FAQ.idNotIncludedDet: Si el ID no está incluido en la transacción, no podemos igualarlo a la donación y no aparecerá en el Colectivo. Por favor, ponerse en contacto con {email} si has recibido una donación que no aparece en el Colectivo para que así podamos seguirla.
acceptContributions.FAQ.moneyNotReceived: ¿Qué pasa si el dinero nunca es recibido?
Los Host sólo añadirán fondos a su Colectivo cuando ellos tengan claro su cuenta bancaria. La donación será mostrada como pendiente hasta entonces.
acceptContributions.HowDoesItWork.detail: Los contribuidores financieros podrán elegir "transferencia bancaria" como método de pago. Las instrucciones para hacer la transferencia, que usted define, serán enviadas a ellos por correo electrónico, junto con un único ID de orden o pedido.
acceptContributions.myselfSuccess: Usted ha aplicado para ser recibido por {hostName}.
acceptContributions.notifiedWhen: Se le notificará cuando {hostName} haya aprobado o rechazado su aplicación. Los niveles de contribución sólo saldrán en vivo una vez que el Colectivo sea aprobado o rechazado por el anfitritrión fiscal.
acceptContributions.picker.hostInfo: Apply to a Fiscal Host. Fiscal Hosts hold money on behalf of Collectives and take care of accounting, taxes, payments, and liability for them. {moreInfo}
acceptContributions.picker.organizationI: Use an organization you own as Fiscal Host  and host multiple collectives. The organization will be responsible for their accounting, taxes, payments, and liability.
acceptContributions.picker.ourselvesInfo: Simply connect a bank account to your collective. You will be responsible for accounting, taxes, payments, and liability.
acceptContributions.picker.subtitle: ¿Quién conservará el dinero en nombre del Colectivo?
acceptContributions.stripe.info: Acepta automáticamente las contribuciones con tarjetas de crédito de todo el mundo.
acceptContributions.success.hostSettings: Puedes gestionar tu configuración de Anfitrión Fiscal — como añadir más métodos de pago — desde el perfil de tu Organización de Anfitrión Fiscal. {takeMeThere}.
acceptContributions.success.toConsider: Algunas cosas más que deberías considerar:
acceptContributions.tiers.paragraphOne: Creamos un nivel de donación de una sola exhibición para que comience. Ahora puede crear diferentes donaciones, de una sola exhibición o por suscripción, para ofrecer diferentes niveles de contribuciones financieras que su colectivo aceptará. {knowMore}.

becomeAHost.aBetterExperience.descriptio: Reporting is automatic and real-time, so everyone can see the up to date budget at any time. Projects can have more direct control over their funds, while fiscal sponsors can ensure everything is done according to their policies.
becomeAHost.benefit.combineFunding.descr: Collectives can seek support through diverse channels while tracking everything in one budget. Crowdfunding, credit card payments, and event ticket sales are built-in, and you can easily credit funds coming in by any other means to the right budget.
becomeAHost.benefit.easyExpense.descript: To withdraw funds, payees submit expenses through the platform, with associated invoices and receipts. Easily view and approve expenses through your admin dashboard—payment via bank transfer or Paypal is built-in, so you can pay in a single click.
becomeAHost.benefit.inDepthReports.descr:
No need to spend time creating reports for funders—it’s all documented automatically and transparently as you go. In addition, you'll receive a consolidated report every month with all transactions and documentation included. 
                Your accountant will thank you!
becomeAHost.benefit.keepTrack: Keep track {lineBreak} of all the budgets
becomeAHost.benefit.keepTrack.descriptio: Create Collectives for as many projects as you need, in a few clicks, at no extra cost. Each has its own page for fundraising, budget tracking, and community engagement. Incoming payments are added to the balance of the right Collective. No spreadsheets required!
becomeAHost.caseStudies.allforclimate-co: A fiscal sponsor for your local climate justice group, we act as a shared administrative back office so that local groups can focus on their actions.
becomeAHost.caseStudies.foundation: The Open Collective Platform provides the tools to more effectively manage group finances. They can offer their donors tax-deductible status without needing to incorporate a legal entity.
becomeAHost.caseStudies.opensource: We provide financial and legal infrastructure for thousands of open source projects. We’re an API between the world of distributed collaboration and the world of accounting and invoices.
becomeAHost.caseStudies.socialchangenest: We have been able to support over 150 Mutual Aid groups to get going quickly by providing them with fiscal hosting back office support.
becomeAHost.caseStudies.wwcode: Whenever we start a new meetup chapter, we pair it with an Open Collective so they have the means to raise money under our umbrella.
becomeAHost.description: Open Collective is purpose-built to streamline your processes, reduce overhead, increase transparency, and enable your organization to hold and manage funds for more projects in less time.
becomeAHost.entity: Any entity with a bank account
becomeAHost.entity.description: Who runs multiple projects and wants to use the Open Collective platform features for transparent budget tracking, combining revenue streams, expense payment management, and community engagement.
becomeAHost.fiscalSponsorshipService.des: In their chosen geography or industry area.
becomeAHost.grantMakers.description: Who want to lower the barriers for unincorporated projects and informal initiatives, while ensuring robust oversight.
becomeAHost.increaseCapacity.description: Open Collective makes it possible for you to offer more services to more projects in less time. Large numbers of transactions won’t overwhelm you, because the platform automates most of the work, and also collects any fund holding fees you set.
becomeAHost.joinUsSection.subtitle: Open Collective makes fiscal sponsorship shine. Grantees and project participants will love the simplicity and accessibility, and you’ll love the huge reduction of overheads.
becomeAHost.networks.description: Who want to enable local fundraising while operating a single common legal entity, such as meetups and social movements.
becomeAHost.nonprofits.description: Who want to enable unincorporated projects that further their mission areas to receive grants and donations under their umbrella.
becomeAHost.reduceOverhead.description: When you’re managing funds for multiple projects or groups, it's easy to get overwhelmed by complex spreadsheets and countless email threads. Open Collective automates budget tracking, reporting, expense processing, and payments, making your job a lot easier.
becomeAHost.title:
Fiscal 
              sponsorship has never been easier
becomeAHost.whatAreTheBenefits: What are the benefits to host with us?
becomeAHost.whatAreTheBenefits.descripti: Accept donations and sponsorship, celebrate your supporters, pay expenses, and keep everyone up to date — all in one place.
becomeASponsor.backYourStack.description: Discover your Open Source dependencies and support them. {knowMore}
becomeASponsor.bulkPayments.description: En lugar de pagar con tarjeta de crédito a cada Colectivo, puede enviar un único pago al anfitrión fiscal por crédito a su organización en la plataforma. Entonces usted puede utilizar este saldo para financiar tantos Colectivos como desee.
becomeASponsor.giftOfGiving.description: Crear tarjetas de regalo para empleados, candidatos, clientes, asistentes a eventos—para que su comunidad pueda apoyar a los Colectivos que les interesan reconociendo a su Organización como el patrocinador.
becomeASponsor.giftOfGiving.title: Obtén el regalo de dar
becomeASponsor.invoiceReceipts.descripti: Dar dinero a las comunidades, movimientos y proyectos puede ser una pesadilla. El Colectivo Abierto resuelve ese problema con la documentación de cada transacción.
becomeASponsor.monthlyInvoice: Además, consigue una factura mensual consolidada para todas tus contribuciones en la plataforma, ¡Tu contador te lo agradecerá!
becomeASponsor.moreFeatures.description: Descubre las posibilidades de nuestras funciones.
becomeASponsor.moreFeatures.title: Más funciones
becomeASponsor.paperWork.description: El anfitrión fiscal del Colectivo que desea apoyar es una entidad legal establecida que puede comprometerse con sus sistemas de proveedores y procesos de órdenes de compra, y cumplir con los requisitos de documentación como formularios fiscales y acuerdos de firma.
becomeASponsor.reporting.description: Además de los informes mensuales, los colectivos pueden publicar actualizaciones periódicas sobre su progreso y el impacto que su apoyo está teniendo, además puedes echar un vistazo a su presupuesto en cualquier momento—¡es como si los informes se escriban solos!
becomeASponsor.supportCommunities: Apoyar a las comunidades y ayudarlas a crecer.
becomeASponsor.supportCommunities.descri: La plataforma Open Collective permite a los sponsors fiscales albergar grupos no incorporados, dándoles una estructura legal con la que te puedes relacionar.
becomeASponsor.supportProjects: Apoya proyectos y comunidades en Open Collective.
becomeASponsor.supportProjects.descripti: Únete a estos grandes fundadores y patrocinadores y apoya iniciativas asombrosas. Contribuciones transparentes y todas las herramientas que necesitas para eliminar el papeleo. Todo en un solo lugar.
Únete a estos grandes fundadores y patrocinadores apoyando Colectivos.
becomeASponsor.sustainersKit.description: Sabemos qué hacer el argumento puertas adentro no siempre es fácil. Para todos los héroes dentro de las empresas, reunimos {resourcesLink}
becomeASponsor.transparency.description: Puedes ver directamente el impacto de tus contribuciones en tiempo real, porque los presupuestos colectivos son transparentes

collective.edit.host.findHost.descriptio: You won't need to hold funds yourself, or set up a legal entity and bank account for your project. The Fiscal Host will take care of accounting, invoices, taxes, admin, payments, and liability. Most hosts charge a fee for this service (you can review these details on the Host's page before confirming).

collective.edit.host.noHost.description: You can't receive financial contributions or use the budget features. You can still edit your profile page, submit expenses to be paid later, and post updates.

collective.githubflow.created.descriptio: Ya está aprobado por el patrocinador ({host}), ya puede recibir donaciones. Siéntase libre de personalizar su colectivo, archivar gastos e incluso crear eventos.
collective.hostAccount.activate.descript: Un anfitrión fiscal es una entidad legal que mantiene los fondos del Colectivo en su cuenta bancaria y que puede generar facturas y recibos para los contribuyentes y patrocinadores.

ContributeDetails.faq.frequency.content: Se le cobrará hoy, y luego el día 1 de cada mes (para contribuciones mensuales) o el día 1 del mismo mes del próximo año (para contribuciones anuales). Nota: Para evitar que se le cobra dos veces en un periodo corto de tiempo, si contribuye después del día 15 de un mes dado, el siguiente cargo no será el 1 del próximo mes, sino el mes siguiente.
ContributeDetails.faq.frequency.title: ¿Cuándo se me cobrará la próxima vez?
ContributeDetails.faq.isIncognito.conten: Si eligió contribuir como "anónimo", su donación se mostrará públicamente como una donación anónima y no será vinculada a su perfil público. Sin embargo, en nuestro esfuerzo por ser transparentes y cumplir con las regulaciones KYC (Conozca a su Cliente, KYC por sus siglas en inglés), el anfitrión fiscal y los administradores del colectivo pueden exportar una lista de todos los contribuyentes financieros junto con su información personal.

ContributeFAQ.Safe: Open Collective no almacena ningún número de tarjeta de crédito, en su lugar confiamos en nuestro socio Stripe -una solución segura que es ampliamente utilizada por la industria. Si nuestros sistemas se ven comprometidos, no podemos perder tu número de tarjeta de crédito porque simplemente no lo tenemos. <LearnMoreLink>Aprende más</LearnMoreLink> sobre la seguridad de Open Collective.

createcollective.opensource.p1: Lo que está creando es un software. No deberá preocuparse por formar una entidad jurídica ni de abrir una cuenta bancaria separada, pagar impuestos o presentar facturas a sus sponsors. Deje que nosotros nos hagamos cargo de todo eso, así puede mantenerse enfocado en su proyecto.
createcollective.opensource.p2: We have created the {osclink}, a non-profit umbrella organization, to serve the open source community. To join, you need at least 100 stars on GitHub or meet our {criterialink}.
createcollective.opensource.p4: Nuestras tarifas cubren costes operativos como contabilidad, pagos, reportes de impuestos, facturas, responsabilidad legal, uso de la Plataforma Colectiva Abierta y proporcionar apoyo. También llevamos a cabo una serie de iniciativas para nuestra misión de apoyar un ecosistema Open Source sostenible y saludable. Más información en nuestra página web. ¡Únete a nosotros!

CreateConversationFAQ.moderation.content: Los administradores de este colectivo pueden eliminar conversaciones que no son apropiadas para la comunidad. Por favor, sea un buen ciudadano de la comunidad.
CreateConversationFAQ.replies.content: Recibirás una notificación por correo electrónico cuando alguien responda. Puedes darte de baja de esas notificaciones en cualquier momento.

CreateExpense.HelpCreateInfo: Request payment from {collective} for work you’ve done or to be reimbursed for purchases. Expenses will be processed for payment once approved by a Collective admin. Only the amount and description are public in the Collective’s transparent budget—attachments, payment details, and other personal info is kept private.
CreateExpenseFAQ.getPaid: ¿Cómo puedo recibir el pago desde un Colectivo?
CreateExpenseFAQ.getPaidDetails: Envíe un gasto y proporcione su información de pago.
CreateExpenseFAQ.howAreApprovedDetails: Los administradores de colectivos son notificados cuando se presenta un gasto y pueden aprobarlo o rechazarlo.
CreateExpenseFAQ.isItPublicDetails: No. Sólo el importe de los gastos y las descripciones son públicos. Adjuntos, información de pago, correos electrónicos y direcciones sólo los podes ver vos y los administradores.
CreateExpenseFAQ.whenPaidDetails: Los pagos son procesados por el anfitrión fiscal del Collective, la organización que tiene los fondos en tu nombre. Muchos anfitriones fiscales pagan gastos semanalmente, pero cada uno es diferente.

createPledge.conditions:
Por el momento, solo puedes prometer proyectos de Código Abierto con un repositorio u organización de GitHub. ¡Nosotros
                pedimos al proyecto que tenga al menos 100 estrellas en GitHub!
createPledge.faq.howToClaim: You’ll need to contact <SupportLink></SupportLink> to prove that you are an admin of this project.
createPledge.faq.howToClaimSummary: How do I claim a pledged collective?
createPledge.faq.pay: Once that pledged collective is claimed, we will email you to fulfill your pledge.
createPledge.faq.what:
A pledge allows supporters (companies and individuals) to pledge
                funds towards a collective that hasn’t been created yet. If you can’t find a collective you want to
                support, pledge to it!
createPledge.faq.whatHappens:
Una vez que alguien hace una promesa a un colectivo, automáticamente creamos un colectivo. No enviamos spam a
                personas, así que por favor ayúdanos a llegar a la comunidad a través de twitter / github o, si puedes, por correo electrónico.
createPledge.faq.whatHappensSummary: ¿Qué pasa después de que me comprometo?
createPledge.githubURL: URL de GitHub: ¡repositorio u organización con al menos 100 estrellas!
createPledge.onceTheyCreateIt:
Una vez que lo crean (y verifiquen que poseen la URL tú introducirás este formulario), recibirás un
                correo electrónico para pedirte que cumplas con tu compromiso.
createPledge.priviledge:
Te has ganado el privilegio de nombrar y describir esta increíble causa. Crearemos una página colectiva
                        para que otras personas puedan encontrarla y comprometerse a ella también.
createPledge.signinToCreate: <signin-link>Inicia sesión o únete gratis</signin-link> para crear un causa.
createPledge.why:
If the cause or collective that you want to support is not yet on Open Collective, you can make a
                pledge. This will incentivize them to create an open collective for their activities and offer you much
                more visibility on how your money is spent to advance their cause.
createProfile.faq.anonymous.content: Yes you can! However, in the effort of being transparent and compliant with KYC regulations (Know Your Customer), anonymous contributions still require you to create an Open Collective account with a valid email address. You will have the opportunity to make a donation anonymously after being logged in to make sure that your identity won't be shown publicly on the page of the collective.
createProfile.faq.anonymous.title: ¿Puedo hacer una aportación anónima?
createProfile.faq.email.content: For legal reasons, your email is shared with the administrators of the collective and of its fiscal host. We don't share it with any other partner. We don't use it for any type of marketing. We hate spam as much as you do.
createProfile.faq.email.title: ¿Con quién será compartido mi correo electrónico?
createProfile.faq.giftsCardsWithIncognit: Unfortunately, gifts cards cannot be used with incognito profiles. Allowing this could allow malicious users to find out what your main profile is. The protection of your personal information is too important for us to take this risk!
¿Por qué no puedo ver mi tarjeta de regalo?
createProfile.faq.persoVsOrg.content: Create an organization profile if you want to make a financial contribution in the name of your company or organization. An organization profile allows you to enable other members of your organization to make financial contributions within certain limits that you can define. Organizations can also issue gift cards.
createProfile.faq.persoVSOrg.title: What's the difference between a personal and an organization profile?
createProfile.faq.privacy.content: We care about privacy. We don't use cookies. No Google Analytics. No tracking. Then why are we asking you for your personal information? Because for legal reasons the host of the collective needs to know who is giving them money (KYC as in Know Your Customer). However, we give you full control on how your information is being shown publicly (yes you can make incognito contributions, see below).
createProfile.faq.privacy.title: ¿Qué hay de la privacidad?
CreateProfile.name.conflict: You can't use the same name for your Personal profile and your Organization.

createProject.form.descriptionLabel: What's the purpose of your Project?
createProject.form.nameLabel: What's the name of your Project?
CreateUpdateFAQ.moderation.content: Only the administrators of this collective can post updates.
CreateUpdateFAQ.notification: ¿Quién recibe una notificación cada vez que hay una nueva actualización?
CreateUpdateFAQ.notification.content: All contributors of the collective will receive a notification by default. They can easily unsubscribe with one click.
CreateUpdateFAQ.target.content: Updates can be public or private in which case only the contributors of the collective can see them. Whenever you post a new update, you can define whether it should be public or private.
CreateUpdateFAQ.whatfor.content: Updates are great to keep your community of contributors up to date with what you do. They should preferably be low volume (at least once a month, ideally no more than once a week). If your contributors hear regularly from you, they will more likely engage, help you and continue to support you. Updates are also great for your fiscal sponsor and for writing reports for grants that you may have.

expenseNeedsTaxFormMessage.msg: We need your tax information before we can pay you. You will receive an email from HelloWorks saying Open Collective is requesting you fill out a form. This is required by the IRS (US tax agency) for everyone who invoices $600 or more per year. We also require one for grant recipients for our records. If you have not received the email within 24 hours, or you have any questions, please contact <I18nSupportLink></I18nSupportLink>. For more info, see our <Link>help docs about taxes</Link>.

The fiscal host will hold funds on your behalf, and take care of accounting, invoices, tax, admin, payments, and liability. Most hosts charge a fee for this service (you can review these details on the host's page before confirming).

GithubRepositories.faq.cost.content: The Open Source Collective 501c6 is taking 5% of all donation received (on top of the 5% for the Open Collective platform). This is to cover the administrative overhead, accounting, legal. That way you never have to worry about all that boring stuff and you can focus on your project.
GithubRepositories.faq.cost.title: ¿Cuál es el coste?
GithubRepositories.faq.host.content: We have created a non profit, the Open Source Collective 501c6 in the United States to act as a fiscal sponsor to host all open source projects. This makes it easy for companies to donate to your project since they can receive one consolidated invoice.
GithubRepositories.faq.host.title: Where is my collective going to be hosted (fiscal sponsored)?
GithubRepositories.faq.repoStar.content: In order to provide fiscal sponsorship to a project, we need to ensure that there is a community around it. If you don’t fit 100 GitHub stars requirement, we will consider your application on a case by case basis, <criteria-link>using this criteria.</criteria-link> If you already have a legal entity (or know a legal entity that could host your collective), then you could directly host your collective independently. Please use the <for-any-community>For any Community</for-any-community> option when creating a collective. Note that in that case you will be responsible for doing the accounting as well as facilitating payments from sponsors. If you have a project with an existing community but don't use GitHub, apply via the <open-source>Open Source</open-source> option and select 'Request manual verification'.
GithubRepositories.faq.repoStar.title: Why only repos with at least 100 stars?

home.OCusers.movements: Muchos grupos locales de XR están utilizando Open Collective para ser transparentes, involucrar a sus comunidades y cubrir sus gastos.

home.whatCanYouDoSection.collectMoney.lo: Receive funds by credit card, Paypal, or bank transfer, and record everything in your transparent budget. Define different ways people can contribute with customizable tiers and rewards.
home.whatCanYouDoSection.manageMoney.lon: Create Collectives for different projects for easy budget tracking. No need for messy spreadsheets! Automatic monthly reports make accounting a breeze.

pricing.fiscalHost.reasonToJoin: If you join a Fiscal Host, you don’t need to go on an Open Collective paid plan, as your Collective is already included. Each Fiscal Host sets their own fees and acceptance criteria for Collectives. Open Collective keeps a 5% of the donations you raise via credit card payments (Stripe). All other payment methods such as PayPal and Bank transfers are included in your Host's plan.

RoleDetails.ACCOUNTANT: Accountants can access all the financial information such as receipts, financial reports or expense's invoices.
RoleDetails.ADMIN: Admins have full permissions on the profile, and can in particular change the settings, approve expenses or make financial contributions to other Collectives.
RoleDetails.MEMBER: Core contributors are team members that you want to showcase on the profile page. Their only special permission is to create events.
RollingLimitFAQ.admins: Who can make payments with 2FA enabled?
RollingLimitFAQ.admins.content: Only host admins will be able to make payments with 2FA enabled. Once 2FA is enabled for payouts, host admins must set up 2FA on their accounts for login before being able to continue making payouts.
RollingLimitFAQ.amount: How do I set the rolling limit amount?
RollingLimitFAQ.amount.content: The default rolling limit amount is {defaultLimitWithCurrency}. You can reset this using the input field above.
RollingLimitFAQ.disable: How do I disable 2FA once it's been enabled?
RollingLimitFAQ.disable.content: For security purposes, 2FA can only be disabled by contacting <I18nSupportLink>support</I18nSupportLink> once it has been enabled.
RollingLimitFAQ.enable: What happens when I enable 2FA for payouts?
RollingLimitFAQ.enable.content: When you go to make payments from the Host dashboard, you will be asked to authenticate with your 2FA code when you make the first payment. Then you will be allowed to make payments that add up to the rolling limit you've set.
